website_summaries.verdict: For buyers who are in search of stylish shoes with a trail-ready look, the Merrell Annex Trax Low is highly recommended. It delivers durable and high-performance elements without forfeiting the comfort and on-trend style essential for the casual scene.This shoe boasts its re-mastered outsole which furnishes dependable traction with a reasonable price point. However, few expressed criticisms about its sizing inconsistencies which bumps off a star to its overall ratings.
pros: Many praise the excellent traction of Merrell Annex Trak Low
Most users find this shoe very comfortable that can be worn all day without straining their feet
Like most Merrell sneakers, few reviewers praise the durability of this sneaker
Its excellent footbed cushioning has been commended several times in the reviews
For some, this footwear provides ample arch support
Many reviewers highly recommend this sneaker to their friends
Quite a few commend the versatility of this sneaker
Some shared that they wear this kick from a simple trail to city pavements, and to their work
The Merrell Annex Trax Low is available in multiple colorways
This shoe can be bought at an affordable price point
cons: Few critics disclose that the Merrell Annex Trax Low needs serious breaking in
They are not as good as shown in the photos, a handful of online buyers have criticized
The pair is not stylish, some buyers have expressed
A couple of reviewers complain about the color discrepancies online and on the actual

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months. Both shoes split from the sole ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 4 months. Both shoes split from the sole on the outer front side. Rubbish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Split after just six months!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of Merrell's for years but these split after just six months and another pair of Merrell's split within one year - NEVER AGAIN!
customer_reviews.author: DJH

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I used to have older model from the same series - those were the best shoes I ever had. Seriously. So I decided to get another pair. It turns out Merrell decided to cut some costs and changed sole material to something different (more "plasticky") - I actually slipped several times already (in a month time?). It never happened before. Not mentioning that left shoe developed some weird bulge along the innersole. As I said - I am seriously disappointed and I believe it was the last time I bought their product. What a shame!
customer_reviews.author: GHUA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot (though more of a shoe than boot). I’m size 10, with fairly wide fitting foot and these were spot on size wise with good support and excellent grip. They are watertight but not waterproof. Not an issue tbh. I’d also read reviews saying people found their normal shoe size was too tight and a half size up was a better fit. Not disputing their experience but a size 10 fitted my size 10 feet perfectly). The first time I wore them I was on my feet for 12 hours. And these fitted like a glove. No rubbing or “breaking in required”. I may buy a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shoes burst after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said, my father ordered a pair of boots on the 11th of September 2019 and now 23 October 2019, the shoes have burst through the side. For a shoe of this cost it is unacceptable for a company to release a product that bursts this easily considering they are made for walking and hiking. And since it's gone just past the 30 day window I can no longer return them and have no way to contact them then other leaving this review as they don't supply and emails for support
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit due to poor information
customer_reviews.text: I have a similar pair of Merrell Annex Trainers, which fitted perfectly. The new pair, which are the same size, 8, are much narrower & therefore very tight even though I have narrow feet. I can find no indication of fitting size (width) in the Amazon advertising or in either of the two pairs of trainers. Definitely not good enough Merrell (and Amazon). In future I will buy in a shop!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don’t normally write reviews but....
customer_reviews.text: I don’t normally write reviews but I thought I would On this occasion, as I bought these trainers for my husband and he loves them. He said they were comfortable straight out of the box with no rubbing whatsoever. The quality is also excellent. The only thing he did say is, it was a good job I ordered him size 11.5 (he is usually a size 11), as his regular size would have been too small.
customer_reviews.author: ChappyCat1

customer_reviews.title: do not buy not durable
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Merrell footwear for the last twenty years and I have always found them comfortable and hard wearing. That is definitely not the case with these, I purchsed them 21st May 2020 and on the 9th September the upper separated from the welt. Now they were comfortable and lightweight in use I'm seeking a replacement or refund as three months use is piss poor
customer_reviews.author: Tango Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Another great merrel purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have brought many pairs of merrels in the past few years. All of them I have found a little tight to start with but within a day or two of wearing them they give a little to fit like a glove. They are always good quality and comfy. I will continue to buy and wear merrels for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Greg. A

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and tough shoes, I wear them to work daily, they are comfy and seem to let my feet breathe. They don't rub and feel like they will last a long time. I'm very happy with them although they maybe look a tiny bit clumsier than I thought they would, I think if you're buying them as a tough but comfy day to day shoe or as a hiking shoe (as I believe they are intended) you're going to be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Fizzy

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but...
customer_reviews.text: These are a lovely pair of shoes, well for the first two weeks anyway, then they developed a really annoying squeak from the heal area as I walk. I have bought Merrell shoes for years now but these seem to be below the standard I would normally expect. How do I get my money back on these shoes as they are driving everyone mad in the office the squeak is so annoying!!
customer_reviews.author: Majordoit

customer_reviews.title: Fake or flawed design. Crushes after a little wear.
customer_reviews.text: Went out of shape causing me numbness in the toes. A terrible trainer compare to my older style Merrels. Wish I could get my money back. Don't buy!! These are fake or flawed design that ends up crushing your big toes.
customer_reviews.author: A.Anon

customer_reviews.title: Split after a month of wear but I received superb customer service
customer_reviews.text: I've bought Merrel walking shoes/boots several times before and never had an issue. These particular ones are very comfortable, I like them a lot. Unfortunately after only a month of regular wear they have split along the side. Very disappointing. I'm revising this review with this addition; despite the product being faulty I have received some simply superb customer service in responce to my complaint which has entirely resolved my issue. Due to this I would now not hesitate to do business with this seller again. I may even reorder the shoes as I was assured it was a one off manufacturing defect. They really are very comfortable shoes. Truely exemplary service!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lever

customer_reviews.title: Not Usual Merrell quality
customer_reviews.text: Total rubbish not to usual Merrell standard. Looking at other reviews this product seems to have a flaw in the outside wall. These shoes have failed within less the six months. Have had a few pairs of Merrells in the past, but the QC must of been on holiday with this batch. Will not buy Merrell again.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Veal

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Original: These get four stars only because I've hardly worn them yet so don't know how long they will last. I'm normally a size 9 but based on other people's comments went up to a 9.5 and they are a lovely fit. They feel snug yet supple and don't appear to need much breaking-in. Update: Less than a year old and not heavily used (walking to and from work a couple of times a week) and they have both split along the join between the upper and sole. Really poor for £70 footwear.
customer_reviews.author: AJB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is excellent. I wanted something more robust than a trainer and not large and heavy like a hiking boot. It is an ideal compromise. It can be used for country walks but also would look fine for taking on a city break. The shoes are very comfortable. The instep gives good support and they fit my medium foot well. If you have very narrow feet they may not be suitable. The colour in the photograph is deceptive. The blue, in reality, is a very dark blue - almost a blue/black, which goes well with the back of the rest of the shoe. The price is excellent for a Merrell product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: julie ortez

customer_reviews.title: Very tight fitting - not very comfortable...
customer_reviews.text: I found them painful on my arches and tight at the toes (I am size 8 5'9" 12st) despite the fact they look as though there would be ample room. I agree with several others that the merrell brand from a few years ago has changed significantly and not for the better - glad l ordered (albeit it in error) through prime as they were tried on but only saw a few steps in my livingroom and returned the same day.
customer_reviews.author: OMG1970

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - beware sizes come up small
customer_reviews.text: Ordered, in my size (an 8), but they were simply too narrow and barely long enough. Still, Amazon brilliant exchange system worked a treat and within two days I had the next size up (8.5) which turned out to be £5 cheaper!! Perfect fit, excellent quality great instep support and ankle support. So buyer beware, they do com up small...and I have narrow feet as well!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wayne Hinsley

customer_reviews.title: Unusually narrow fit
customer_reviews.text: I would love to be able to wear these trainers but I found them to be a very narrow fit and I've have had to return them after trying two different sizes. I have other Merrell shoes and boots that I love, and these are made to the same high standard, but even in a full size bigger than I usually buy these pinch the sides of my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not up to the usual Merrill standard
customer_reviews.text: I have used the shoes for long walks of up to 7 miles. They are comfortable but they lack support in the arch of the foot and I find that after walking a couple of miles this is quite evident. For the serious walker they do not really cut the mustard and are more like casual shoes for kicking around in.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these merrells. They have a design fault
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy as merrell always are. Always order 1/2 size larger than my usual shoe size. All great until I noticed a tear in the leather where it meets the sole. Checked an identical pair that are a few months older and they to are torn. Thats two pairs that are less than a year old! I have read other reviews saying the same. Never have this issue with merrell before. They have always been so well made. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Tony P.

customer_reviews.title: A bargain
customer_reviews.text: I was nearly put off these shoes by the negative reviews but, encouraged by the considerable discount, I thought I should give them a try. My feet are 10.5 but I ordered 11 and they fitted perfectly. First time on, maybe recklessly, I did a seven mile cross country trek and had no discomfort or problems. On the contrary, I greatly enjoyed the feel of the shoes and their instep support. I have now walked about fifty miles in the week since they arrived and am delighted I bought them. Don't be deterred by the negative reviews!
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: disappointing. wont be buying again.
customer_reviews.text: wear it hiking and every winter day to work and back. Very comfortable and most importantly - water tight without being smelly if you know what I mean. only a few weeks old though......That was oct/nov 2018. Eleven months later, with not that many rough outings, they began leaking through a crack like in one of the pictures and now from both shows, making them unusable. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: gerrard

customer_reviews.title: Top layer peeled off within a months....
customer_reviews.text: Avoid!!! Merrell this product is nothing but poor quality shoes. The top layer start peeling off within a month... Not sure this is genuine product, what a disappointment and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sonic

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These are the 5th pair of Merrill footwear I have owned and feel let down after loving my others. I purchased these in a 12 as they were to replace the ones I wear for work which were 12 and fit great. Never buying shoes online again. The left one fits great and is comfortable. The right one however feels 2 sizes smaller and really presses on the top of my foot. Really hoping they stretch as looks and build quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. Hunton

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Have had 7 pairs of other Merrell in the past always been the most comfy and the only way mail order. These are the second pair, first pair was s/h sold as new, harder than other Merrel but still comfortable. Best of all they are genuine waterproof and not makers claim of being waterproof, 99% are not.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Slightly larger than expected...but very comfortable with a thick pair of socks
customer_reviews.text: To my mind these are quite stylish shoes...built more for urban environments than for country trails. They are slightly roomier than I typically expect from a size 10.5 (I've bought many Merrell shoes...they're probably my favourites) but they're fine with a thick pair of socks. Overall...very happy as always with Merrell products!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Woods

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Half a size up on normal shoes but this is my third pair so I knew which size to order, these are great all year around and are pretty waterproof. Have used them to go up the Tatra mountains, cycle for a hybrid and walk around the U.K. Never had a problem with any pair that I have had and only shear wear and tear leads me to get my next pair
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gerard K

customer_reviews.title: Shoes split along sole after 4 months of light use
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a pair of shoes for walking between my office and the train station as part of my daily commute. I didn't even wear the shoes throughout the day as I have a different pair of shoes for inside the office. Despite this extremely light usage the shoes have split along the sole and now constantly leak and are basically useless. I have had much cheaper shoes last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: S. Officer

customer_reviews.title: Second pair that hasn't lasted - didn't last 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for second time in March 2020 and the upper has split from the sole after 5 months. Hugely disappointed. I bought as a replacement for a pair that similarly came apart prematurely so more fool me - I've learned my lesson. I think I should be able to get a refund but the "window closed end of July" so the manufacturer maybe expects these to last only a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Stubbo

customer_reviews.title: Ever wanted to moonwalk? Buy these
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoes however as soon as it rains these things have ZERO traction. I’m not even talking about outdoors in nature I’m talking Sauchiehall street in light drizzle these things have no traction. As for outdoors I’ve almost broke an ankle and went on my backside more than once.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Halligan

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice Merrell shoes, 3 months in and they're doing fine. Nice chunky laces, and I like how they're all black and a bit more subtle than other models (no luminous stitching etc). The outer material is a sort of rubbery plain black - can't be polished or cleaned but it is quite durable so far.
customer_reviews.author: bcalvert

customer_reviews.title: Slippery.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are comfortable, well made and fit as expected. The need no breaking in, look good and over all I’m happy. But... the soles are slippery on some surfaces. Admittedly I’m a city dweller and not using them for what they were designed for but all the same I’ve nearly fell on my backside more than once. If your looking for a pair of shoes like this for an urban environment I’d look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Steviett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boots, good price
customer_reviews.text: This was the second pair of this Merrell model we bought. These boots are really waterproof, reliable on long hikes and very comfortable. The Merrell size is one size smaller than UK shoes size, so we normally buy one size up. The price was excellent as normally these boots are quite pricy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Early days yet but first impressions are great! Nice comfy fit, feet are warm ! Good support !! And lots of grip
customer_reviews.author: giantsparky

customer_reviews.title: Poor quantity and not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I’m really disappointed with this purchase. I’ve bought Merrell’s before due to there quality, comfort and durability. I work 4 x 12 hour shifts a week and bought this latest pair thinking they would last at least 6 months and be easy on my feet. I could have not been more wrong. Comfort is ok however after 5 weeks the seams on both shoes have split. I would expect this after 6 months, not 5 weeks. I would not recommend these if you looking for durable shoe
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Locker

customer_reviews.title: Robust and comfy
customer_reviews.text: They're really comfy. I ran in these shoes when went out with the dog and they were great even for running. They absorb shocks impressively well. The only issue I had was the internal lining in left shoe has torn after 2 months while in the other one still looked as a new, but Amazon quickly send the new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Marcin

customer_reviews.title: Split after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Had these for a year but didn’t wear them much in that time because my old Merrells were still going strong. Sadly, after starting to wear these for a few months they have spilt in the same way that other reviewers have reported, resulting in soggy feet. I’ve owned many pairs of Merrells over the last decade and loved them. Time to move on now.
customer_reviews.author: Martin1979

customer_reviews.title: Splits Quickly
customer_reviews.text: Used to walk to and from work for a 3 mile round journey over city roads, pavements and footpaths. They split like this after 41 days of use. They are very comfortable shoes, but they split much too quickly. I can only assume this is a bad batch, as I have had other Merrell shoes that have lasted much longer. Its very disappointing that the returns window closes after a month. Based on this experience I could not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: mr_kyle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husband had a pair of Merrell's for years and they were so good he wanted an identical pair, however they were discontinued. It turns out these have replaced them and he is over the moon with this pair also. They are so comfortable and lightweight for walking and leisure and great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Split after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Normally Merrell are my preferred shoe, might have a rethink. These shoes split after 4 months of average use. While they were fit for use, they were comfortable & good for general walking around town.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Crooks

customer_reviews.title: Not the high standard, they used to be
customer_reviews.text: Ok well made but certainly not up to the high standards I'd come to expect from previous three pairs of Merrell walking trainers , on the whole quite disappointed with them. Fit rather on the slack side, not much real support.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hardwick

customer_reviews.title: Quality a bit suspect
customer_reviews.text: Really nice, comfy shoes but 3.5 months of light wear and these came apart - the rubber strips along the outside front parted from the base on both shoes. The rubber appears to have perished. Amazon refunded without argument and the shoes are returning to them, so I am off to find a different pair.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Mayes

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband who has a wide foot. Very comfortable and good fit. After just over a month, a split/hole appeared and the rubber above the sole looks perished. We have sent these shoes back to Amazon who are sending us a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde P.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality - Upper separated from sole
customer_reviews.text: I have had many pairs of Merrells in the past, all lasting 2-3 years of mixed use. This is the first pair I was disappointed with. I have had them approx 9months and used only for day to day activities, I returned them as the sole had separated from the upper and split along the join. This is either poor workmanship or bad design. I have received a replacement pair from Amazon, as I would expect these shoes to last at least 2 to 3 years based on previous use and experience of Merrells. Hopefully the replacement pair will last a lot longer and not develop the same problem. I cannot fault the Amazon returns procedure.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Justin M Robbins

customer_reviews.title: No more Merrells
customer_reviews.text: Have worn Merrell shoes for 17 years and never buy anything else. They fit me perfectly and are extremely comfortable. Sadly they appear to have started to use lower quality materials in the production and now they are absolute crap. Last 3 pairs have failed to last 6 months. Thought it was just bad luck at first, but now I realise that is not the case. Sad really. They used to be brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Jonesy

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. Prefect for slightly narrower foot
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Prefect for slightly narrower foot. They come with high arch support insoles which don't suit me but easy to pull out and replace with a flat odour eater. Will see how they last before buying again but first impressions are great.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan McAfee

customer_reviews.title: Go up 1/2 a size
customer_reviews.text: Very very comfortable. I am a perfect size 10. Go half a size up otherwise toes have no movement whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Fine if you have two different sized feet !
customer_reviews.text: Ordered size 11, received one 10.5 and one 11, not much else to say really, learn from my mistake I guess !
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easycare shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, waterproof,wipe clean and at the £80 I paid, good value. I usually take a size 9 and that’s the size I took in these.
customer_reviews.author: RHarrison

customer_reviews.title: In the bin after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I had seen other comments about these shoes splitting where the upper and sole are joined but thought that these were one offs and the Merrell brand was good quality. My pair have split after 5 months use and on checking the condition of the sole you can see that they are certainly not worn out. I would advise you to avoid - £60 down the drain!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Like Merrells!
customer_reviews.text: A good shoe, lightweight, comfortable, usual Merrell fit (go up one UK size) - I like these shoes but not as good as Merrell's best ever shoe, the Coda!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Falling to bits.
customer_reviews.text: ordered this product on 24/9/19. I have had a current pair of Merrell shoes for over 10 year that I still wear in the garden. After 5 weeks this pair have 5 splits and are falling apart on a daily basis. I have the photographic evidence to show this (including hardly worn sole) and would be grateful for a prompt reply to sort this problem out. .
customer_reviews.author: AndyH

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these shoes since June and have covered in excess of 20 miles a day every day in them mostly walking pavement but also a few muddy fields and they have been fantastic. They broke in really nicely didn’t cause me to get any blisters kept feet dry and I am only replacing now due to the padding around the heel having holes through to the outer and a small hole around the left little toe area. Build quality is fantastic and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Less than 4 months old and the soles have started to split. Bought Merrell for years but the quality is so bad now. Save your money and try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Halliday

customer_reviews.title: not as good as I thought they would be.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these 6 months ago and my original impression was good. I walk about 25 miles a week and after 6 months the padding on the heel has worn through exposing the hard frame of the shoe. I can't wear them anymore despite the soles being in good condition. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: PHIL

customer_reviews.title: Not up to usual Merrell standards
customer_reviews.text: Used for seven months, but sized small and had quite a pronounced arch support. Wore out and were replaced by Amazon after those seven months. Honestly, I'm usually a fan of Merrell shoes but I just can't bring myself to recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Just some bloke

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Size 12 for 40yrs. Why suddenly am I required to up size with a manufacturer traditionally generous with sizes.
customer_reviews.author: DST

customer_reviews.title: poor quality for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Initially happy, although I normally wear 10 and had to get size 11 (uk). After 4 months both shoes had started to split so I contacted amazon who offered a refund or a replacement pair. I should have taken the former but opted for the latter. 2 months later the same splitting is starting to occur. Disappointed that I can't return them now. It will definitely put me off this brand in future.
customer_reviews.author: pmca123

customer_reviews.title: Merrell quality as usual..
customer_reviews.text: My third pair of Merrell footwear.. for me they are relatively indestructible.. I walk a lot and hopefully these will be as robust as my present pair of light walking shoes.. these are slightly sturdier but fit great.. and feel comfortable..
customer_reviews.author: Toldyaso

customer_reviews.title: Great to find large shoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought as an all round shoe for a bit of healthy walking and with the dog and pleasure mountain bike riding, look and feel nice , good comfort not too wide fit ,as a guide my feet are approx 12.5cm wide ,light at around 580grams for size 14 uk , like that it has a vibram sole ,I don't know how waterproof they are ( if at all ) as i haven't tested yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fitting
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other Merrell shoes and boots I've bought, these are a very narrow fitting so I had to return them. Obviously I didn't wear them other than to try on but the soles also appeared to be hard and inflexible compared to my other Merrells with Vibram soles.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: first walk was 6miles and no discomfort anywhere. pleased with how they look Updated after use: less than a year later and with only a moderate amount of wear, the sole separated from the upper on both shoes. Binned them and am very disappointed as its a premium brand.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Good service (arrived very quickly) and product. The shoes look well put together. Of course only time will tell but on first use I am very pleased. Looking at buying another pair in a different colour. I am a happy customer...
customer_reviews.author: leigh gordon

customer_reviews.title: Snug but Comfy.
customer_reviews.text: I take a 9, ordered a 9.5. It was too small so I then ordered a 10. This was fine though snug. I would say that, as always (in my experience) these Merrells are on the small side. These are also a shade narrow. That said, the 10s, though a little snug, are very comfy and I'm sure they'll become more so.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H

customer_reviews.title: Useless after 13 months
customer_reviews.text: I expect Merrill products to last, after just over a year but these shoes have split between the sole and the upper and the sole is almost worn down . I am really disappointed. I found them very comfortable, I wore them every day during a 3 month trip to New Zealand, about half the time at home. Not a good buy. Not durable.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Owers

customer_reviews.title: poor quality £30 shoe sold as "£100 reduced to £60" - do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is very comfortable, which is why it has so many 5 star reviews. The problem is a quality product lasts. I noticed the sides were split after 3 months of low use. This is the type of poor quality I would expect from a very cheap shoe. I feel the constant discount is there for a reason...
customer_reviews.author: slaughter

customer_reviews.title: Slip and slide
customer_reviews.text: Even though they have a vibram sole they become very slippery on wet or slightly damp surfaces becoming dangerous, I have lots of Merrell shoes and boots and didn't expect this problem, also they are very narrow, have returned them, not the quality and performance I am used too.
customer_reviews.author: mrbojingle

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable rugged good anti slip
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable straight out of the box, no breaking in. Good anti slip tread. Order a size larger than normal, they run small. They're not waterproof but they are showerproof. I'd recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: MelP

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of this particular shoe. I love them. They are so comfortable have good grip and waterproof. You can wear them all day long whether shopping, walking or going to the local pub.
customer_reviews.author: johnboy007

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Split along the show and some at the toe bend point within 3 months. Worst shoes I’ve ever purchased, Merrell have noticeably sold out on quality in recent years. No more for me!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Comfy shoes
customer_reviews.text: I normally take a size 8 but had to get a 8 1/2, so if you’re considering getting them go up half a size. Insanely comfortable and supportive. They arc slightly slippy to start with on wet surfaces but after a few days that goes. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Exact fit
customer_reviews.text: So far so good only time will show how long they last.I have use them just for couple short walks and they comfy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soul not typical of Vibram
customer_reviews.text: I found them treacherously slippery and nearly fell over on a slightly wet floor - I would return them, although I have already worn them. Will not wear them again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: 'Sign of the times'
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is as good as it was with cost cutting and corporate greed . These Merrell shoes are the same with hard plastic soles and nothing like the Merrell of old . I wanted a soft pair of trainers and instead got rock hard boots . Synthetic sole is the product description but stiff plastic would be more appropriate .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In the recent frosty mornings on walking on untreated pavement ...
customer_reviews.text: In the recent frosty mornings on walking on untreated pavement these grip and make walking feel very safe having bought Merrells before lives up to expectation and can wear straight from the box
customer_reviews.author: b hardy

customer_reviews.title: Massive let down
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these trainers around 5 months. With lockdown I’ve barely put any mileage in them but they’re already falling apart. Crap considering the brand
customer_reviews.author: John Gray

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: These shoes look great, fit great but are the worst pair for wear I have ever experienced. I first got them on the 20th April and within a few days of wearing them the uppers had come away from the soles in both shoes. I obtained a replacement pair on the 10th May and 6 weeks later the same thing has happened and they are fit only for the bucket. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Demetra Whyte

customer_reviews.title: Quality comfort stylish
customer_reviews.text: Great quality leather walking shoes at a knockdown price. I am size 10 normally and glad chose 10.5 for this shoe as they fit perfectly after day or so to break in. Love the red laces!
customer_reviews.author: a r watt

customer_reviews.title: Quality comfort and reliability
customer_reviews.text: The Merrill shoes I am wearing Are 5 yrs old the leather uppers are still in excellent condition and there’s plenty sole left my new shoes are almost identical so I expect them to last just as long
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these. Used most days, but only lasted 6 months before they started to split. Quality very poor. Will not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Cave Boy

customer_reviews.title: Normally take size 10.5 so purchased these in 11.5: too small! should have bought 12 or 12.5!
customer_reviews.text: Very well crafted shoe, but not comfortable - most likely because I should have purchased 12.5, but as I normally wear 10.5, I had [reasonably] thought that 11.5 would be a correct fit. I was so wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Arkle

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used them for walking the dogs a couple of hours a day for 8weeks and they’ve got a hole in. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: Merrell are brilliant
customer_reviews.text: My wife had a problem with Merrell trainers which were just out of guarantee. Merrell were under no obligation to do anything but they replaced the trainers with no fuss whatsoever. I will never buy any other brand now.
customer_reviews.author: David Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I brought these shoes for my grandson and his very pleased with them
customer_reviews.author: Cat lady

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit to my normal shoe size. Well made and comfortable. Time will tell whether they go the distance but first impressions are good.
customer_reviews.author: Whaley Bridge John

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality Merrell shoe, already ripped
customer_reviews.text: I have had these shoes for 3 months and they have already split open on both shoes. If you are considering buying these with hope of it lasting longer than 3 months dont! If you're happy that it lasts only this long then it's very comfortable shoe. Where has Merrell quality gone, it used to be a go to shoe.
customer_reviews.author: FW

customer_reviews.title: Waist of money
customer_reviews.text: 9 August delivered 19 October and that's how day look like
customer_reviews.author: Jarzyna

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw - split shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great to start with but shoe has split after only 6 months. I don’t expect a design flaw and lack of quality from Merrel. Need them replaced but not surprisingly it’s hard to find anything about product returns on the order page. Hmm.
customer_reviews.author: Random Wibbling

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe.
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of this shoe purely because I used them so much. Lovely wide fit with no cramped toes. Look great on and this colour matches up with a pair of blue jeans.
customer_reviews.author: alan ratcliff

customer_reviews.title: Ok but did not survive long
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoes but they lasted 4 months before the inside lining started to break apart...
customer_reviews.author: j f m

customer_reviews.title: Sizing caution
customer_reviews.text: If you are considering this shoe please read reviews. It is an excellent comfortable shoe, but, consider ordering a half size larger than your usual size and if you intend wearing thicker socks such as thermal/walking socks I’d suggest ordering a full size bigger. Nice shoe though.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable Footware
customer_reviews.text: Well made, soft liner, comfortable on long walks. Every day walks!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. L. A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Avoid these shoes, they will split in less than three months!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were very comfortable whilst they lasted, which was less than three months!! Both shoes split on the outer edges (see photos), as other reviewers have found. I contacted Amazon customer services and returned them for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb Merrell product.
customer_reviews.text: A quality Merrell product. Great use of colours and beautifully made. Superb value for money. Great company to deal with - item was well packaged in manufacturing box and prompt postage.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Grouls

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable but they split after 5 months of use and were returned for a refund. I had a pair of the previous generation of these and they lasted 2 years, quality has definitely taken a nose dive with Merrell, I would think twice before buying any of their shoes again, which is a shame because I really like the style and they are very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: MR G J Hughes

customer_reviews.title: As comfortable as ever!
customer_reviews.text: As is usual with merrell footwear these trainers are exceptionally comfortable and unlike the regular annex trainers this new range have insoles that don't move about inside the shoe as you walk. This makes them more comfortable, although not quite as good in appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy and stylish (I like the red laces that give them a traditional hiking look). Wore them around the Dolomites this summer (including a number of 20Km+ walks) and were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger JH

customer_reviews.title: Great Merrell’s yet again
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and easy to wear straight out of the box. Always like Merrell’s and these don’t disappoint
customer_reviews.author: Jevvy

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: My husband really liked these but they were too small. He is always a size 11. But not in these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Annex Trak Low Multisport Shoes
product_meta.description: Journey around the block or through the woods in a multisport shoe with a vibram sole. They comfort, grip, and fit like they were made only for you. Nubuck leather and mesh upper Protective rubber rand and toe cap breathable mesh lining fit.Eco blended eva contoured foot bed with organic odour control moulded nylon arch shank eva midsole for stability and comfort vibram outsole for traction in all weather and temperature conditions.
feature_bullets: EVA contoured footbed with organic odor control
